intro: Riedelia microbotrya, commonly known as the dwarf riedelia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its vine-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically followed by orange or red fruits. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
